verses.kjv: Against Moab thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Woe unto Nebo! for it is spoiled: Kiriathaim is confounded and taken: Misgab is confounded and dismayed.
verses.web: Of Moab. LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Woe to Nebo! For it is laid waste. Kiriathaim is disappointed. It is taken. Misgab is put to shame and broken down.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says about Moab: "Disaster has come to Nebo — it lies in ruins! Kiriathaim has been captured and put to shame. Its fortress is shattered and disgraced."

verses.kjv: There shall be no more praise of Moab: in Heshbon they have devised evil against it; come, and let us cut it off from being a nation. Also thou shalt be cut down, O Madmen; the sword shall pursue thee.
verses.web: The praise of Moab is no more. In Heshbon they have devised evil against her: ‘Come! Let’s cut her off from being a nation.’ You also, Madmen, will be brought to silence. The sword will pursue you.
verses.ct: Moab's glory is gone. In Heshbon, enemies plot against her: "Come, let's wipe her out as a nation." You too, Madmen, will be silenced — the sword is coming for you.

verses.kjv: A voice of crying shall be from Horonaim, spoiling and great destruction.
verses.web: The sound of a cry from Horonaim, desolation and great destruction!
verses.ct: Listen — cries ring out from Horonaim: devastation and terrible destruction!

verses.kjv: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
verses.web: Moab is destroyed. Her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
verses.ct: Moab is shattered. Her children cry out in anguish.

verses.kjv: For in the going up of Luhith continual weeping shall go up; for in the going down of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.
verses.web: For they will go up by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping. For at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the distress of the cry of destruction.
verses.ct: People climb the road to Luhith, weeping without end. On the descent to Horonaim, the enemy hears desperate cries of ruin.

verses.kjv: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.
verses.web: Flee! Save your lives! Be like the juniper bush in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Run for your lives! Be like a wild bush in the desert — alone and hidden.

verses.kjv: For because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou shalt also be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity with his priests and his princes together.
verses.web: For, because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures, you also will be taken. Chemosh will go out into captivity, his priests and his princes together.
verses.ct: Because you trusted in your achievements and your wealth, you too will be captured. Your god Chemosh will be hauled away into exile, along with his priests and officials.

verses.kjv: And the spoiler shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape: the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed, as the LORD hath spoken.
verses.web: The destroyer will come on every city, and no city will escape; the valley also will perish, and the plain will be destroyed; as LORD has spoken.
verses.ct: The destroyer will sweep through every city — not one will escape. The valley will be ruined and the plateau destroyed, just as the LORD has declared.

verses.kjv: Give wings unto Moab, that it may flee and get away: for the cities thereof shall be desolate, without any to dwell therein.
verses.web: Give wings to Moab, that she may fly and get herself away: and her cities will become a desolation, without anyone to dwell in them.
verses.ct: Give Moab wings so she can fly away, because her cities will become wastelands with no one left to live in them.

verses.kjv: Cursed be he that doeth the work of the LORD deceitfully, and cursed be he that keepeth back his sword from blood.
verses.web: “Cursed is he who does the work of LORD negligently; and cursed is he who keeps back his sword from blood.
verses.ct: Cursed is anyone who carries out the LORD's work halfheartedly, and cursed is anyone who holds back his sword from bloodshed.

verses.kjv: Moab hath been at ease from his youth, and he hath settled on his lees, and hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither hath he gone into captivity: therefore his taste remained in him, and his scent is not changed.
verses.web: “Moab has been at ease from his youth, and he has settled on his lees, and has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither has he gone into captivity: therefore his taste remains in him, and his scent is not changed.
verses.ct: Moab has been comfortable since its youth, like wine left sitting on its sediment, never poured from one jar to another, never sent into exile. So its flavor has stayed the same, and its smell hasn't changed.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will send unto him wanderers, that shall cause him to wander, and shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles.
verses.web: Therefore behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will send to him those who pour off, and they will pour him off; and they will empty his vessels, and break their containers in pieces.
verses.ct: "But the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will send people to tip him over. They will pour him out, empty his jars, and smash his containers to pieces."

verses.kjv: And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel their confidence.
verses.web: Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
verses.ct: Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, just as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, the god they had relied on.

verses.kjv: How say ye, We are mighty and strong men for the war?
verses.web: “How do you say, ‘We are mighty men, and valiant men for the war?’
verses.ct: "How can you say, 'We are warriors — brave men ready for battle'?"

verses.kjv: Moab is spoiled, and gone up out of her cities, and his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: Moab is laid waste, and they have gone up into his cities, and his chosen young men have gone down to the slaughter,” says the King, whose name is LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: Moab is devastated. Enemies have marched into her cities, and her finest young men have gone down to the slaughter," says the King, whose name is the LORD of Armies.

verses.kjv: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hasteth fast.
verses.web: “The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hurries fast.
verses.ct: "Moab's disaster is closing in fast. His downfall is rushing toward him."

verses.kjv: All ye that are about him, bemoan him; and all ye that know his name, say, How is the strong staff broken, and the beautiful rod!
verses.web: All you who are around him, bemoan him, and all you who know his name; say, ‘How the strong staff is broken, the beautiful rod!’
verses.ct: All you who live near him, grieve for him. Everyone who knows his reputation, say: "How the mighty scepter is broken — that beautiful staff of power!"

verses.kjv: Thou daughter that dost inhabit Dibon, come down from thy glory, and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of Moab shall come upon thee, and he shall destroy thy strong holds.
verses.web: “You daughter who dwells in Dibon, come down from your glory, and sit in thirst; for the destroyer of Moab has come up against you. He has destroyed your strongholds.
verses.ct: "You people of Dibon, come down from your place of honor and sit in the dust, parched with thirst. The destroyer of Moab is coming against you, and he will tear down your fortresses."

verses.kjv: O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way, and espy; ask him that fleeth, and her that escapeth, and say, What is done?
verses.web: Inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way and watch. Ask him who flees, and her who escapes; say, ‘What has been done?’
verses.ct: People of Aroer, stand by the road and watch. Ask the man running away and the woman escaping, "What happened?"

verses.kjv: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,
verses.web: Moab is disappointed; for it is broken down. Wail and cry! Tell it by the Arnon, that Moab is laid waste.
verses.ct: Moab is humiliated — completely broken. Wail and cry out! Announce it along the Arnon River: Moab has been destroyed!

verses.kjv: And judgment is come upon the plain country; upon Holon, and upon Jahazah, and upon Mephaath,
verses.web: Judgment has come on the plain country, on Holon, on Jahzah, on Mephaath,
verses.ct: Judgment has fallen on the plateau — on Holon, Jahazah, and Mephaath,

verses.kjv: And upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Bethdiblathaim,
verses.web: on Dibon, on Nebo, on Beth Diblathaim,
verses.ct: on Dibon, Nebo, and Bethdiblathaim,

verses.kjv: And upon Kiriathaim, and upon Bethgamul, and upon Bethmeon,
verses.web: on Kiriathaim, on Beth Gamul, on Beth Meon,
verses.ct: on Kiriathaim, Bethgamul, and Bethmeon,

verses.kjv: And upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.
verses.web: on Kerioth, on Bozrah, and on all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.
verses.ct: on Kerioth, Bozrah, and every other city in the land of Moab, near and far.

verses.kjv: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, saith the LORD.
verses.web: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Moab's strength is cut off and his power is broken," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Make ye him drunken: for he magnified himself against the LORD: Moab also shall wallow in his vomit, and he also shall be in derision.
verses.web: “Make him drunken; for he magnified himself against LORD. Moab will wallow in his vomit, and he also will be in derision.
verses.ct: "Make him drunk, because he defied the LORD! Moab will collapse in his own vomit and become an object of ridicule."

verses.kjv: For was not Israel a derision unto thee? was he found among thieves? for since thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.
verses.web: For wasn’t Israel a derision to you? Was he found among thieves? For as often as you speak of him, you shake your head.
verses.ct: "Didn't you mock Israel? Was he caught among thieves? Every time you mentioned him, you shook your head in contempt."

verses.kjv: O ye that dwell in Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock, and be like the dove that maketh her nest in the sides of the hole’s mouth.
verses.web: You inhabitants of Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock. Be like the dove that makes her nest over the mouth of the abyss.
verses.ct: You people of Moab, abandon your cities and go live among the rocks. Be like a dove that nests on the ledges over a deep gorge.

verses.kjv: We have heard the pride of Moab, (he is exceeding proud) his loftiness, and his arrogancy, and his pride, and the haughtiness of his heart.
verses.web: “We have heard of the pride of Moab. He is very proud in his loftiness, his pride, his arrogance, and the arrogance of his heart.
verses.ct: "We've all heard about Moab's pride — his incredible arrogance, his conceit, his swagger, and the haughtiness of his heart."

verses.kjv: I know his wrath, saith the LORD; but it shall not be so; his lies shall not so effect it.
verses.web: I know his wrath,” says LORD, “that it is nothing; his boastings have done nothing.
verses.ct: "I know his defiance," declares the LORD, "but it amounts to nothing. His boasting has accomplished nothing."

verses.kjv: Therefore will I howl for Moab, and I will cry out for all Moab; mine heart shall mourn for the men of Kirheres.
verses.web: Therefore I will wail for Moab. Yes, I will cry out for all Moab. They will mourn for the men of Kir Heres.
verses.ct: So I will wail for Moab — I will cry out for all of Moab. My heart mourns for the men of Kirheres.

verses.kjv: O vine of Sibmah, I will weep for thee with the weeping of Jazer: thy plants are gone over the sea, they reach even to the sea of Jazer: the spoiler is fallen upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage.
verses.web: With more than the weeping of Jazer I will weep for you, vine of Sibmah. Your branches passed over the sea. They reached even to the sea of Jazer. The destroyer has fallen on your summer fruits and on your vintage.
verses.ct: I weep for you, vine of Sibmah — more than I wept for Jazer. Your branches spread all the way to the sea; they reached as far as Jazer. But the destroyer has fallen on your summer fruit and your grape harvest.

verses.kjv: And joy and gladness is taken from the plentiful field, and from the land of Moab; and I have caused wine to fail from the winepresses: none shall tread with shouting; their shouting shall be no shouting.
verses.web: Gladness and joy is taken away from the fruitful field and from the land of Moab. I have caused wine to cease from the wine presses. No one will tread with shouting. The shouting will be no shouting.
verses.ct: Joy and celebration have vanished from the orchards and fields of Moab. I have stopped the flow of wine from the presses. No one treads the grapes with joyful shouts anymore — the shouting that remains is not the sound of joy.

verses.kjv: From the cry of Heshbon even unto Elealeh, and even unto Jahaz, have they uttered their voice, from Zoar even unto Horonaim, as an heifer of three years old: for the waters also of Nimrim shall be desolate.
verses.web: From the cry of Heshbon even to Elealeh, even to Jahaz they have uttered their voice, from Zoar even to Horonaim, to Eglath Shelishiyah; for the waters of Nimrim will also become desolate.
verses.ct: The cries from Heshbon reach all the way to Elealeh and Jahaz, from Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath Shelishiyah. Even the waters of Nimrim have dried up.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith the LORD, him that offereth in the high places, and him that burneth incense to his gods.
verses.web: Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab,” says LORD, “him who offers in the high place, and him who burns incense to his gods.
verses.ct: "I will put an end to everyone in Moab who makes offerings at the high places and burns incense to his gods," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore mine heart shall sound for Moab like pipes, and mine heart shall sound like pipes for the men of Kirheres: because the riches that he hath gotten are perished.
verses.web: Therefore my heart sounds for Moab like pipes, and my heart sounds like pipes for the men of Kir Heres. Therefore the abundance that he has gotten has perished.
verses.ct: My heart wails for Moab like a funeral flute, and it wails like a flute for the men of Kirheres, because all the wealth they accumulated is gone.

verses.kjv: For every head shall be bald, and every beard clipped: upon all the hands shall be cuttings, and upon the loins sackcloth.
verses.web: For every head is bald, and every beard clipped. There are cuttings on all the hands, and sackcloth on the waist.
verses.ct: Every head is shaved and every beard is cut short. Everyone's hands are slashed, and sackcloth covers every waist.

verses.kjv: There shall be lamentation generally upon all the housetops of Moab, and in the streets thereof: for I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein is no pleasure, saith the LORD.
verses.web: On all the housetops of Moab, and in its streets, there is lamentation everywhere; for I have broken Moab like a vessel in which no one delights,” says LORD.
verses.ct: On every rooftop in Moab and in every street, there is nothing but mourning, because I have smashed Moab like a pot that nobody wants," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: They shall howl, saying, How is it broken down! how hath Moab turned the back with shame! so shall Moab be a derision and a dismaying to all them about him.
verses.web: “How it is broken down! How they wail! How Moab has turned the back with shame! So will Moab become a derision and a terror to all who are around him.”
verses.ct: "How shattered it is! How they wail! Moab has turned away in disgrace!" Moab has become an object of mockery and horror to everyone around him.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; Behold, he shall fly as an eagle, and shall spread his wings over Moab.
verses.web: For LORD says: “Behold, he will fly as an eagle, and will spread out his wings against Moab.
verses.ct: For the LORD says: "Look — an enemy swoops down like an eagle, spreading his wings over Moab."

verses.kjv: Kerioth is taken, and the strong holds are surprised, and the mighty men’s hearts in Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.web: Kerioth is taken, and the strongholds are seized. The heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.ct: The cities are captured and the fortresses are seized. On that day, the hearts of Moab's warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.

verses.kjv: And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he hath magnified himself against the LORD.
verses.web: Moab will be destroyed from being a people, because he has magnified himself against LORD.
verses.ct: Moab will be wiped out as a nation because he defied the LORD.

verses.kjv: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, shall be upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Terror, the pit, and the snare are on you, inhabitant of Moab,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Terror, the pit, and the trap await you, people of Moab," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for I will bring upon it, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “He who flees from the terror will fall into the pit; and he who gets up out of the pit will be taken in the snare: for I will bring on him, even on Moab, the year of their visitation,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Anyone who runs from the terror will fall into the pit, and anyone who climbs out of the pit will be caught in the trap. For I am bringing upon Moab the year of their punishment," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: They that fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon because of the force: but a fire shall come forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and shall devour the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.
verses.web: “Those who fled stand without strength under the shadow of Heshbon; for a fire has gone out of Heshbon, and a flame from the middle of Sihon, and has devoured the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.
verses.ct: "Exhausted fugitives huddle in the shadow of Heshbon, but fire blazes out from Heshbon — a flame from the city of Sihon — and it devours the borders of Moab and burns the skulls of those who stirred up chaos."

verses.kjv: Woe be unto thee, O Moab! the people of Chemosh perisheth: for thy sons are taken captives, and thy daughters captives.
verses.web: Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh are undone; for your sons are taken away captive, and your daughters into captivity.
verses.ct: Disaster has come to you, Moab! The people of Chemosh are finished — your sons are dragged away as captives and your daughters into exile.

verses.kjv: Yet will I bring again the captivity of Moab in the latter days, saith the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
verses.web: “Yet I will reverse the captivity of Moab in the latter days,” says LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
verses.ct: "Yet in the days to come, I will restore the fortunes of Moab," declares the LORD. This concludes the judgment against Moab.
